title: Type family similar to Futura
content:
Hello,

I have a bizarre client who wants a new type family to use across all communications. She likes futura but doesn't want to use it, she wants something like futura. She's a strange lady.

Can anyone recommend a family with range of weights, all with italics and condensed & bold condensed for display? It's a big client so budget isn't a problem.

I like Super Grotesk but no italics unfortunately!

Love to hear some ideas.
author: mrjono

comments.content: Should also mention I'm considering Gotham and Verlag from H&FJ, to give you an idea of far I'd consider moving away from Futura
Try [Fakt (alternate)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410092457/https:/ourtype.com/#/try/pro-fonts/fakt-alternates/), comes with condensed weights, too.

And if it’s for the _one-storey a_ you could also try (the alternate versions of)

[Proxima nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410092457/http:/www.marksimonson.com/fonts/view/proxima-nova)  
 [Andes](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410092457/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/latinotype/andes/)  
 [FS Albert](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410092457/http:/www.fontsmith.com/fonts/fs-albert.cfm?tab=detail&)

All come with condensed/narrow weights.
Thanks, Proxima is a good shout, had forgotten about it!
I just ran across Report School from Typodermic, which seems like it could be an answer.

don't know about that but you can visit  
 [anysolution](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410092457/http:/www.bessnet.com/)
